Course Description: The aim of this course is to introduce various topics in Number Theory such as Farey fractions, continued fractions, partitions, quadratic forms and geometry of numbers.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Ability to explain the approximation of irrational numbers with rational numbers using the theory of Farey fractions
Course Outcomes.CO2: Ability to explain the relation between convergents of a simple continued fraction and best approximations, and ability to construct the fundamental solution of Pell's equation.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Ability to explain and develop combinatorial and algebraic proofs of several identities involving partition functions
Course Outcomes.CO4: Ability to explain and develop combinatorial and algebraic proofs of several identities involving partition functions
Course Outcomes.CO5: Ability to explain the theory of quadratic forms proof of Minkowski's and to demonstrate its convex body theorem applications. and to demonstrate its applications

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Farey Fractions and Irrational Numbers: Farey sequences, Rational approximations, Irrational Numbers, Hurwitz’s Theorem.

Continued Fractions: Finite continued fractions, convergents to a continued fraction, continued fractions with positive quotients, simple continued fractions, the representation of an irreducible rational fraction by a simple continued fraction, the continued fraction algorithm and Euclid’s algorithm, the difference between the fraction and its convergents, Infinite simple continued fractions, the representation of an irrational number by an infinite continued fraction, periodic continued fractions, representation of quadratic surds by continued fractions, Approximation by convergents, Hurwitz’s Theorem, Pell’s Equation.

Partitions: Partitions of Numbers, Generating functions, Geometric representations, Two theorems of Euler and further algebraic identities, Jacobi’s triple product identity and its special cases, congruence properties of p(n), The Rogers-Ramanujan identities, Ramanujan’s continued fraction.
Quadratic forms: Positive quadratic forms, Equivalence of quadratic forms, Hermite’s Theorem, Sums of squares.
Geometry of Numbers: Blichfeldtz’s Principle, Minkowski’ s Convex Body Theorem and its applications.

Textbook: G. H. Hardy and E. M. Wright, An Introduction to the Theory of Numbers
I.Niven, H.S. Zuckerman, and H.L. Montgomery, An Introduction to the Theory of Numbers
G.E. Andrews, The Theory of Partitions
